com.chap.links.client
Class Timeline.Options

java.lang.Object
  AbstractDrawOptions
      com.chap.links.client.Timeline.Options
Enclosing class:
Timeline
public static class Timeline.Options
extends AbstractDrawOptions

Options for drawing the timeline. Create an instance via the method create, for example Timeline.Options options = Timeline.Options.create();

setHeight

public final void setHeight(java.lang.String height)
Set the height for the Timeline in pixels or percentages. WHen height is set to "auto", the height of the Timeline is automatically adjusted to fit the contents. See also setMinHeight to set a minimum height.

Parameters:
height - Height as a string, for example "100%" or "500px", or "auto"

setGroupsChangeable

public final void setGroupsChangeable(boolean groupsChangeable)
If true (default), items can be moved from one group to another. Only applicable when groups are used. Default value is true.

Parameters:
groupsChangeable -

public final void setLocale(java.lang.String locale)
Set the locale for the timeline.

Parameters:
locale - Available locales: "en", "ca", "de", "da", "ru", "es"

Parameters:
min - Minimum date

setMax

public final void setMax(java.util.Date max)
Set a maximum Date for the visible range. It will not be possible to move beyond this maximum.

Parameters:
max - Maximum date

setIntervalMin

@Deprecated
public final void setIntervalMin(long intervalMin)
Deprecated. 

Set a minimum interval for the visible range in milliseconds. It will not be possible to zoom in further than this minimum.

Parameters:
intervalMin - Minimum interval in milliseconds (default is 10)

setZoomMin

public final void setZoomMin(long zoomMin)
Set a minimum zoom interval for the visible range in milliseconds. It will not be possible to zoom in further than this minimum.

Parameters:
zoomMin - Minimum interval in milliseconds (default is 10)

setIntervalMax

@Deprecated
public final void setIntervalMax(long intervalMax)
Deprecated. 

Set a maximum interval for the visible range in milliseconds. It will not be possible to zoom out further than this maximum. Default value equals about 10000 years.

Parameters:
intervalMax - Maximum interval in milliseconds

setZoomMax

public final void setZoomMax(long zoomMax)
Set a maximum zoom interval for the visible range in milliseconds. It will not be possible to zoom out further than this maximum. Default value equals about 10000 years.

Parameters:
zoomMax - Maximum zoom interval in milliseconds

setScale

public final void setScale(Timeline.Options.SCALE scale,
                           double step)
Set a custom scale. Automatic scaling will be disabled. For example scale=SCALE.MINUTES and step=5 will result in minor steps of 5 minutes, and major steps of an hour. Available scales: MILLISECOND, SECOND, MINUTE, HOUR, DAY, MONTH, YEAR. As step size, choose for example 1, 2, 5, or 10.

Parameters:
scale -
step -

setStyle

public final void setStyle(Timeline.Options.STYLE style)
Set the style for the timeline.

Parameters:
style - Choose from BOX (default), or DOT

setAnimate

public final void setAnimate(boolean animate)
Set animate to true (default) or false. When true, events are moved animated when resizing or moving them. This is very pleasing for the eye, but does require more computational power.

Parameters:
animate -

setBoxAlign

public final void setBoxAlign(java.lang.String alignment)
Set alignment for items with style "box". Choose from "center" (default), "left", or "right".

Parameters:
alignment -

setAnimateZoom

public final void setAnimateZoom(boolean animateZoom)
Set animating when zooming to true (default) or false. When true, events are moved animated when zooming the Timeline. This looks cool, but does require more computational power.

Parameters:
animateZoom -

setSnapEvents

public final void setSnapEvents(boolean snapEvents)
If true (default), the start and end of an event will be snapped nice integer values when moving or resizing the event.

Parameters:
snapEvents -

setEventMargin

public final void setEventMargin(int margin)
Set the event margin for the events. The distance between the events will be minimally equal to this distance.

Parameters:
margin - The minimum margin between events, in pixels. Default is 10 pixels.

setEventMarginAxis

public final void setEventMarginAxis(int margin)
Set the minimal distance between the events and the axis.

Parameters:
margin - The minimum margin between events, in pixels. Default is 10 pixels.

setDragAreaWidth

public final void setDragAreaWidth(int dragAreaWidth)
Set the width of the drag areas in pixels. When an event range is selected, it has a drag area on the left and right side, with which the start or end time of the even can be manipulated.

Parameters:
dragAreaWidth - width of the drag areas pixels.

setStackEvents

public final void setStackEvents(boolean stackEvents)
If set to true, the events are stacked above each other to prevent overlapping events.

Parameters:
stackEvents -

setShowMajorLabels

public final void setShowMajorLabels(boolean showMajorLabels)
By default, the timeline shows both minor and major date labels on the horizontal axis. For example the minor labels show minutes and the major labels show hours. When showMajorLabels is false, no major labels are shown.

Parameters:
showMajorLabels -

setShowMinorLabels

public final void setShowMinorLabels(boolean showMinorLabels)
By default, the timeline shows both minor and major date labels on the horizontal axis. For example the minor labels show minutes and the major labels show hours. When showMinorLabels is false, no minor labels are shown. When both showMajorLabels and showMinorLabels are false, no horizontal axis will be visible.

Parameters:
showMinorLabels -

setShowCurrentTime

public final void setShowCurrentTime(boolean show)
If set to true (default), a vertical line is shown at the current time

Parameters:
show -

setShowNavigation

public final void setShowNavigation(boolean show)
If set to true, a navigation menu is shown, containing buttons to move and zoom the timeline. Default value is false.

Parameters:
show -

setShowButtonAdd

public final void setShowButtonAdd(boolean show)
If set to true (default), and the timeline is editable, an add button is shown in the navigation menu

Parameters:
show -

setShowCustomTime

public final void setShowCustomTime(boolean show)
If set to true, the custom time bar is shown. This vertical line can be dragged byIf true, the timeline shows a blue vertical line displaying a custom time. This line can be dragged by the user. The custom time can be utilized to show a state in the past or in the future. When the custom time bar is dragged by the user, an event is triggered, on which the contents of the timeline can be changed in to the state at that moment in time. Default is false

Parameters:
show -

setAxisOnTop

public final void setAxisOnTop(boolean axisOnTop)
If set to true, the axis is shown on top. If false (default), the axis is shown at the bottom

Parameters:
axisOnTop -

setGroupsOnRight

public final void setGroupsOnRight(boolean groupsOnRight)
If set to true, the groups legend is shown at the right. If false (default), the groups are shown at the left.

Parameters:
groupsOnRight -

setMoveable

public final void setMoveable(boolean moveable)
If true (default), the timeline can be moved. When the timeline moved, the rangechange events are fired.

Parameters:
moveable -

setZoomable

public final void setZoomable(boolean zoomable)
If true (default), the timeline can be zoomed. When the timeline is zoomed, the rangechange event is fired.

Parameters:
zoomable -

setSelectable

public final void setSelectable(boolean selectable)
If true (default), the events on the timeline can be selected. n an event is selected, the select event is fired.

Parameters:
selectable -

setEditable

public final void setEditable(boolean editable)
If true (default), the events can be edited, created, deleted. Events can only be editable when the option selectable is true (default). When the Timeline is editable, it can fire events change, edit, add, and delete.

Parameters:
editable -
